channel.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
channel.description: Any recommendations as to where I should apply?

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @owner_robert12 owner robert12
item.description:
@owner_robert12 wrote:

i can give you a web design, remote support help job. If you want email robert@robertsgames.com with some work you have done and some information on how good you are.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:61, topic:339478”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=435864.msg3204252#msg3204252 date=1273630651]

quite. thats what i tell my parents when they tell me to go into medicine or business, i tell them id rather make a little less money and do something i enjoy

Contrary to belief, I quite enjoy business, the fundamentals and seeing how big and far I can take it! Though I am only 20 years old so I have a lot of time ahead of me, I suppose it runs in my blood with my grandfather and father both having large and successful businesses.

i never said nobody could enjoy business. im talking about my personal interests
[/quote]
Yea was stoned when I read your post, and went off on my own tangent. [/quote]
LOL. I read that before reading what you said in the quote, and I must admit I chuckled.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:58, topic:339478”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=435864.msg3204191#msg3204191 date=1273624130]

quite. thats what i tell my parents when they tell me to go into medicine or business, i tell them id rather make a little less money and do something i enjoy

Contrary to belief, I quite enjoy business, the fundamentals and seeing how big and far I can take it! Though I am only 20 years old so I have a lot of time ahead of me, I suppose it runs in my blood with my grandfather and father both having large and successful businesses.
[/quote]
i never said nobody could enjoy business. im talking about my personal interests[/quote]
Yea was stoned when I read your post, and went off on my own tangent.

But the key thing in a job is ensure you have a challange, if there is no challange, you will end up getting bored very fast.

item.source: Looking for a job as a computer technician

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

your only choice is to go into some computer places and ask for a job. nobody cares that people can put computers together, i can, all programmers can, all network engineers can, 90% of IT people can and many non i.t people (once you realize having the skills to put a computer together/repair/fix them is useless as many others can do it, youll be better off)

get your hands on any i.t related entry level job you can and progress.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a job as a computer technician

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Ollie:

Contrary to belief, I quite enjoy business, the fundamentals and seeing how big and far I can take it! Though I am only 20 years old so I have a lot of time ahead of me, I suppose it runs in my blood with my grandfather and father both having large and successful businesses.

So do I. I love entrepreneurship. But if I’d find myself working in an office, I’d turn down a promotion if it meant that I had to have my mind set on the job 24/7.

Read full topic

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:53, topic:339478”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=435864.msg3203617#msg3203617 date=1273581647]
A job isn’t just a job, contrary to the beliefs of some. There are boring jobs, and fun jobs.

Why anyone would aspire to do this for a living is beyond me.
[/quote]

Heck, I’d be willing to trade in some salary for a job I’d enjoy more. A less succesful career instead of working overtime? Count me in![/quote]
quite. thats what i tell my parents when they tell me to go into medicine or business, i tell them id rather make a little less money and do something i enjoy

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:38, topic:339478”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=435864.msg3202390#msg3202390 date=1273443303]
Becoming an intern usually means working for free in order to learn the trade. Most companies in IT accepts them despite lack of education if you can provide them with some sort of previous experience and/or interest in the subject.
[/quote]

competitive companies can afford to completely ignore people with no experience or education

shit, think of all the game companies where you need a degree just to do an internship/shitty monkey job[/quote]

ISSS THISSS TRUEEEE!!?!?

item.source: Looking for a job as a computer technician

item.title: Looking for a job as a computer technician
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:40, topic:339478”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=435864.msg3202549#msg3202549 date=1273452529]

[quote author=Koolvin link=topic=435864.msg3202497#msg3202497 date=1273450083]

[quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=435864.msg3202373#msg3202373 date=1273442403]

[quote author=Davidude link=topic=435864.msg3202340#msg3202340 date=1273439853]

Geek squad sucks for the record, just a bunch of fucking retards who can put a cd in a computer and reformat.
[/quote]Regardless, it’s a job.

W3 certification is definately a legitimate document. Certification is certification. My question wasn’t what your opinion on my legitimacy is, I’m asking where a good place to work would be to gain reputable experience in computer servicing.

Anywhere but geek squad please. I would lose all respect for you.

Do you actually have respect for him?

have you tried looking in a local newspaper?

Yeah this^. Just yesterday my mum pointed out that there was a few jobs going local in the paper asking for web designers. I don’t like web design though so fuck that
[/quote]I don’t have a thorough portfolio, so It’s very difficult to get a job that’s advertised state-wide.

All they asked for was experience in dreamweaver lol

Wow experince in dreamweaver counts as experince in web design…although I love dreamweaver it doesn’t necessarily mean you’re good at web design.
[/quote]Making a website in dreamweaver is like making a sandcastle; only a few people will see it, you can’t do anything with it, and it never turns out as good as u thought it would… Not to mention it uses massive amounts of HTML to do miniscule tasks.

What the fuck are you talking about. I use it to edit html / php files, it offers autocomplete so that you don’t have to type the whole word, and has syntax highlighting, it also allows for real-time previews (which work more or less) and also allows for you to open the current file you are editing in various browsers via a drop down menu or hotkeys. From your description it sounds as if you have never used the program or even heard of it until it was mentioned in this post.
[/quote]If you have used dreamweaver’s automated functions, you’d understand. I use notepad. Stop assuming that I’m an idiot, I haven’t given you a reason to. I’m asking kindly for advice, your trolling has heeded very little response, just take it elsewhere.[/quote]

Stop trolling me.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a job as a computer technician

[quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=435864.msg3202373#msg3202373 date=1273442403]

[quote author=Davidude link=topic=435864.msg3202340#msg3202340 date=1273439853]

Geek squad sucks for the record, just a bunch of fucking retards who can put a cd in a computer and reformat.
[/quote]Regardless, it’s a job.

W3 certification is definately a legitimate document. Certification is certification. My question wasn’t what your opinion on my legitimacy is, I’m asking where a good place to work would be to gain reputable experience in computer servicing.

Anywhere but geek squad please. I would lose all respect for you.

Do you actually have respect for him?

have you tried looking in a local newspaper?

Yeah this^. Just yesterday my mum pointed out that there was a few jobs going local in the paper asking for web designers. I don’t like web design though so fuck that
[/quote]I don’t have a thorough portfolio, so It’s very difficult to get a job that’s advertised state-wide.

All they asked for was experience in dreamweaver lol

Wow experince in dreamweaver counts as experince in web design…although I love dreamweaver it doesn’t necessarily mean you’re good at web design.
[/quote]Making a website in dreamweaver is like making a sandcastle; only a few people will see it, you can’t do anything with it, and it never turns out as good as u thought it would… Not to mention it uses massive amounts of HTML to do miniscule tasks.

What the fuck are you talking about. I use it to edit html / php files, it offers autocomplete so that you don’t have to type the whole word, and has syntax highlighting, it also allows for real-time previews (which work more or less) and also allows for you to open the current file you are editing in various browsers via a drop down menu or hotkeys. From your description it sounds as if you have never used the program or even heard of it until it was mentioned in this post.[/quote]If you have used dreamweaver’s automated functions, you’d understand. I use notepad. Stop assuming that I’m an idiot, I haven’t given you a reason to. I’m asking kindly for advice, your trolling has heeded very little response, just take it elsewhere.
